conclusion: The side cd is the fixed rotation axis (vertical).
Let θ be the rotation angle measured from the initial position (θ = 0 in the drawing).
The uniform magnetic field B is vertical, coming out of '×' (i.e. pointing into the page).
The effective area that cuts the flux is S sin θ.
Magnetic flux through the loop: Φ(θ) = B · (S sin θ).
Induced emf: ε(θ) = – B S ω cos θ.
At θ = 60° (π/3 rad), ε60° = – (½) B S ω.
Magnitude of ε60°: |ε60°| = (½) B S ω.
Instantaneous induced current I60° = (½) B S ω / R.
Direction of current is clockwise when viewed from above.
Average emf over 0° to 60°: ε̄ = – (3√3/2π) B S ω.
Magnitude of average emf: |ε̄| = (3√3/2π) B S ω ≈ 0.83 B S ω.
Instantaneous induced current after 60° rotation: I60° = (½) (B S ω)/R, clockwise.
Average induced emf during the 0 → 60° rotation: ε̄ = – (3√3/2π) B S ω.
